main event: A bright object resembling a meteor was sighted over Las Cruces, New Mexico on July 24, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as extremely bright with a teal tail and reddish-brown color,It was observed traveling at approximately 5 degrees per second, which is considered too slow for a meteor,The sighting was confirmed as a meteor sighting,The object changed colors from white to yellow and appeared one-fourth the size of the moon before disappearing suddenly,There were related sightings in Chapel Hill, N.C., about 10 days later, suggesting a possible pattern.
sighted object: a bright object resembling a meteor
